text: Max Theiler (January 30, 1899 â€“ August 11, 1972) was an South African-American virologist. He won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1951 for developing a vaccine against yellow fever. He was born on January 30, 1899 in Pretoria, South African Republic and died on August 11, 1972 in New Haven, Connecticut. ==References== Category:1899 births Category:1972 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:South African Nobel Prize winners Category:South African scientists Category:American virologists Category:White South African people Category:People from Pretoria
title: Max Theiler
